Presentation: 

 The Habidar consists of a set of mathematical calculations where you need to find out the digit (s) hidden in a computation generated randomly. The sum hits points to his record. The weight of the score is given according to the response time and the game settings. You will have 6 options sorted to choose which one reaches the calculation solution. 
 

Game types: 

 There are 5 different types of selection in the game. 
 - Type 1: In this game you must find out the right-most digit of two compute number. 
 - Type 2: In this game you must find out the left-most digit of two compute number. 
 - Type 3: In this game you must find out the right-most digit of a number and the left-most digit of other number. 
 - Type 4: In this game you must find one of the 3 numbers of the calculation not counting your result. 
 - Type 5: In this game you must find out the result of the calculation. 
 

Rules of the calculations: 

 - The calculations only have 3 numbers and your solution. 
 - The numbers are random between 0 and 99. Thus leaving a maximum of 2 digits for each number. 
 - Arithmetic operators are also random and consists only of addition and subtraction. 
 - The options of choice will never be negative, except in the game type 5. 


Scoring rules: 

 The score varies according to the remaining time after responding and the maximum set time. 
 - If the maximum time is set to 30 seconds to score only the remaining time. 
 - If the maximum time is set to 20 seconds is twice the score of the first. 
 - If the maximum time is set to 10 seconds the score is five times the first. 


Good game!
